overview.title: An integrated logistics network serving Chad
overview.intro: Through the Chad Dry Port in Douala and future sites in Kribi and NgaoundÃ©rÃ©, GPM is establishing a continuous logistics chain connecting port, rail and inland platforms. This progressive approach aligns with the national vision for trade and transport modernization.

objective.title: Project Objective
objective.content: The Chad Dry Port in Douala is a strategic and highly profitable project, designed to secure and accelerate Chad's trade flows while reducing logistics costs for operators.

context.title: Context & Justification
context.content: As a landlocked country, Chad depends on coastal countries' port infrastructure for its external trade. The Doualaâ€“N'Djamena corridor handles over 85% of the country's trade, but suffers from high delays, cargo breaks and logistics costs reaching 30 to 40% of final goods prices. This project streamlines and digitalizes the logistics chain, strengthening regional (CEMAC) competitiveness.

legal.title: Legal & Institutional Framework
items: New York Convention (1967) guaranteeing landlocked access to sea

technical.title: Technical Description
technical.content: The Chad Dry Port in Douala combines a container terminal and integrated logistics platform (customs clearance, warehousing, financial services, catering, etc.). It includes a 4-floor administrative building, container area, service station and rail network connected to PAD. The site integrates photovoltaic installations and digital security devices.

governance.title: Governance & Performance
governance.content: GPM manages the project through a board of directors, experienced management and technical, financial and legal committees. Performance indicators (transit time, volumes, security, customer satisfaction) are monitored to ensure optimal operations.
